senses.de: The place or position where something is
senses.ex: The location of the meeting has changed to the conference room on the tenth floor.

Tips.title: Not Just Geography
Tips.description: Location can refer to abstract positions, like in arguments or plans, not only physical places.
Tips.example: Our location in this debate is clear, we support more environmental protection.

Tips.title: Collocation Cue
Tips.description: Pay attention to 'location' with words like 'change,' 'exact,' and 'determine' to clarify context.
Tips.example: His exact location was finally determined after hours of searching.

Tips.title: Dynamic or Static
Tips.description: 'Location' can imply movement or permanence depending on the context it's used in.
Tips.example: I'll send you my current location every hour during the trip.

senses.de: In film making, a place out of studio where scenes are shot
senses.ex: The movie was shot on location in Paris.

Tips.title: Beyond Studios
Tips.description: On-location filming adds authenticity, showing the film is shot in a real-world setting.
Tips.example: They're shooting on location to give the film a realistic New York City vibe.

Tips.title: Scouting Process
Tips.description: Location scouting involves finding the perfect place to match a film's artistic vision.
Tips.example: The director went location scouting in Spain for the perfect beach scene backdrop.

senses.de: In computing, a position defined within a system like memory or on a disk
senses.ex: The program saves the file to a specific location on the hard drive.

Tips.title: Accuracy Needed
Tips.description: In computing, specifying a location must be exact, like an address, for the system to work properly.
Tips.example: Make sure the file's location path is correct, or the program won't find it.

Tips.title: Different System Levels
Tips.description: Location in computing can mean different things at various system levels – from files to memory cells.
Tips.example: The program crashed because it tried to access a location in memory that doesn't exist.

senses.de: In real estate, the place where a property is situated
senses.ex: The location of a property can greatly affect its value.

Tips.title: Value Indicator
Tips.description: In real estate, 'location' often refers to desirability and can determine property value.
Tips.example: Despite its size, its excellent location makes it a valuable property.

Tips.title: Specificity Matters
Tips.description: Be specific about property location, like 'beachfront' or 'suburban,' to provide clear context.
Tips.example: They were looking for a house in a quiet, suburban location away from the city bustle.

Area.wordDefinition:
Area refers to a space or region, such as a specific part of a city, a park, or a room. It usually refers to a larger space.

Location refers to a particular place, such as an exact street address or a specific spot within an area. It usually refers to a smaller space.

For example, you could say "I live in the downtown area," referring to a larger region of the city, or "My house is located on Main Street," referring to a specific address within that area.

Locale.wordDefinition:
Locale refers to a specific area or region with particular characteristics, such as cultural or linguistic aspects.

It can also refer to a specific setting or environment, such as the locale of a movie scene or a fictional book.

So, while locale implies a specific cultural or environmental context, location simply refers to a physical position. For example, you could say "The locale of this story is a small town in the Midwest," but you would say "The location of the grocery store is on Main Street.".

Place.wordDefinition:
Location refers to a specific point or geographical coordinates on a map, while a place refers to a specific area or region with distinctive characteristics.

If someone were to ask you for a good place to eat in the city, you would mention an area or region known for its restaurants.

Location is often used when referring to precise points on a map, such as in geography or navigation, while place is used when referring to more general regions or areas with distinct characteristics, such as in social and cultural contexts.

Position.wordDefinition:
Location refers to a specific place, area or site where something or someone is situated. It conveys a general sense of the area where something or someone is positioned, but not the exact spot.

Position refers to the exact spot or placement of something or someone. It conveys a specific sense of the location of an object or person in relation to a fixed point or surroundings.

For example, the position of a chair in a room could be next to a window.

Location is used when we talk about a general area where something or someone is situated, and position is used when we talk about the specific spot where something or someone is located.

Region.wordDefinition:
Region refers to a larger area that is defined by common characteristics such as climate, culture, or geography.

A region can be a group of states, countries, or even continents.

For example, New York City is a location within the region of the Northeastern United States. A forest can be a location within the region of the Pacific Northwest.

Location refers to a singular point while a region refers to a larger area with shared characteristics.

Site.wordDefinition:
Site refers to a specific place where something is located or planned to be located, usually referring to a specific area of land.

For example, the site of the Eiffel Tower is on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.

In simpler terms, location is a more general term that refers to an area, whereas site is a more specific term that refers to a particular place within that area.

Location can be applicable to anything from a city to a single room in a house, while site is usually used when talking about construction or excavation projects.

Spot.wordDefinition:
Spot generally refers to a specific point or place within a location.

It describes a particular area or landmark within a larger area. For example, "My favorite spot in Central Park is the Bethesda Fountain.".

Location refers to a broader area, while spot refers to a specific point within that area.

Territory.wordDefinition:
Territory refers to an area of land that is under the control of a particular government, kingdom, or organization.

In simpler terms, location is about where something is, while territory is about who has control over a specific area.

For example, a store's location can be identified by its address or GPS coordinates, while a country's territory includes all the land it governs.

Venue.wordDefinition:
Venue refers to a specific place where an event or activity takes place. For example, a concert or a wedding would have a venue or location.

Location is the general area where something is situated, while a venue is a specific place where an event or activity takes place.

quotes.Text: I've always had a process that I do before I even get to set or go to the location. I work privately, and it almost feels like therapy between me and who I'm playing. So I have this inner life that's there and it gives me a confidence, too, that when I'm playing the role I know every question.
quotes.Title: Actress
quotes.Name: Kirsten Dunst

quotes.Text: I love to be on location. I love to be in other parts of the world. I love to be where I'm reminded about real, you know, emotions. I love to touch things and design things, and I think that, for the actor, it certainly - it certainly helps their performance.
quotes.Title: Danish Director
quotes.Name: Nicolas Winding Refn

quotes.Text: It's a strange thing when someone passes away. It's always when you're not expecting it that you're affected by it. When we first started filming, we were filming with existing characters in a location that we'd never been before.
quotes.Title: British Comedian
quotes.Name: Greg Davies

quotes.Text: Working at night helps people focus in on this crazy little bubble you've created, wherever you are filming. It doesn't matter where the location is, the world doesn't exist outside this bubble. And everyone is trapped inside.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Ray Stevenson

quotes.Text: Every time you say yes to a film there's a certain percentage of your yes that has to do with the director, a certain percentage to do with the story, a certain percentage with the character, the location, etc.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Guy Pearce

quotes.Text: We will continue to set the standards in the industries in which AEG operates, bringing our unique vision and development model to entertainment locations throughout the world.
quotes.Name: Philip Anschutz

quotes.Text: What's so great with 'Game of Thrones' is that there are so many characters and they're so many locations and that it's just very inspiring.
quotes.Title: German Composer
quotes.Name: Ramin Djawadi

quotes.Text: It interests me to imagine characters shifting from one situation and one location to another for whatever the circumstances may be.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Jhumpa Lahiri

quotes.Text: It's always difficult to work out on location, away from home, but that's the actor's life. You go where the work is.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jon Tenney

quotes.Text: Location is a very important aspect to songwriting.
quotes.Title: British Playwright
quotes.Name: Ken Hill
